data.name: btn_SetCurrentValues
data.value: Set current values for all images selected for editing...

data.name: ckb_AddXMPSideCar
data.comment: Settings - Whether the xmp file belonging to the image should be edited.

data.name: ckb_DoNotQueryAPI
data.value: Do NOT do reverse geocoding (only get the coordinates, but not the City/state/etc)

data.name: ckb_IncludePredeterminedCountries
data.comment: Settings - This relates to overriding certain "predetermined" countries' logics when it comes to the API allocation of data.

data.name: ckb_OverlayGPXForSelectedDatesOnly
data.value: Only for dates that fall within the first & last date of the selected files

data.name: ckb_OverwriteOriginal
data.value: Do NOT Make a xxx_original Backup
data.comment: Settings - Whether to overwrite the original file (rather than making a backup)

data.name: ckb_PopulatedPlacesOnly
data.value: Only display API data filtered to "Populated places" (fcode=PPL) [not recommended]
data.comment: Settings - Whether the API should only return values of "populated places". This is an internal definition of the API

data.name: ckb_ProcessOriginalFile
data.comment: Settings - Refers to whether the original image file should be processed (overwritten)

data.name: ckb_RemoveGeoDataRemovesTimeOffset
data.value: The "Remove Geodata" function also removes TimeZone Offset
data.comment: Settings - Whether to remove the time offset data when issuing a 'remove all geodata' command.

data.name: ckb_ReplaceBlankToponyms
data.value: Replace blank City, State, Sublocation values with:
data.comment: Settings - Allows to preset a default value for blanks

data.name: ckb_ResetFileDateToCreated
data.value: Reset Image File DateTime to CreateDate
data.comment: Settings - Whether the image file's datetime should be aligned with the CreateDate in the Exif

data.name: ckb_ResetMapToZero
data.value: Set Map to 0/0 if no GeoData
data.comment: Settings - Whether to set the map to 0/0 coordinates if there is no geodata in the exif for the file

data.name: ckb_StopProcessingRules
data.value: Stop processing rules after first Country+Target match
data.comment: Settings - Means that if a value is "hit" by a rule then no more rules should be processed.

data.name: ckb_UpdateCheckPreRelease
data.value: Check for Pre-release [beta] updates as well?

data.name: ckb_UseDarkMode
data.value: Use Dark Mode in the App UI?

data.name: ckb_UseImperialNotMetric
data.value: Use Imperial (Feet) for Altitude (rather than Metric [Metres])

data.name: ckb_UseTimeZone
data.comment: Import GPX - Specifies which time zone to use

data.name: clh_Folder
data.comment: Refers to the location of a file

data.name: cmi_OpenCoordsInAPI
data.comment: Open the file's GPS coordinates in a browser window (specifically in GeoNames API)

data.name: cmi_removeCachedData
data.comment: Remove all cached data for a selected file

data.name: cmi_ShowHideCols
data.comment: Form to let the user show or hide columns

data.name: frm_FrmPickDataFromAPIBox
data.comment: Form name (this form shows when the user picks coordinates that have more than 1 nearby relevant value and are asked to pick the right one.)

data.name: frm_FrmPleaseWaitBox
data.value: Please wait while the folder loads.

data.name: lbl_CameraTimeNote
data.value: Note: Time Shift is needed only when the image timestamps are not properly synchronized with GPS time. Leave as 0s unless required.

data.name: lbl_CancelPressed
data.value: Cancel Pressed. Folder parsing has stopped but files that have been collected will be parsed.

data.name: lbl_ExportTrackTimeStampTypeNote
data.value: If you select GPSDateTime and your file has no such attribute the export will fail. Some HEIC files have this, most other formats don't.

data.name: lbl_GeoMaxExtSecs
data.value: Max extrapolation (time diff between Taken TimeStamp and Trackpoint TS) time in seconds.

data.name: lbl_GeoMaxIntSecs
data.value: Max interpolation ('path guessing') time in seconds. Set to 0 to disable.

data.name: lbl_importFromAnotherFolder
data.value: <-- Click there set the Import Source Folder

data.name: lbl_importOneFile
data.value: <-- Click there set the Import Source File

data.name: lbl_ImportTimeAgainst
data.value: Compare the timestamp in the Track Files against:

data.name: lbl_QuestionAddToponomy
data.value: Do you want to also assign Altitude and Toponomy values? If you pick No, your lat/long data may become out of sync with any embedded toponomy data. If you click 'stop asking' it will take the answer as Yes and won't ask again this session. Restart to reset.

data.name: lbl_TZNote
data.value: Note: If the date/time tag does not include a timezone then one may be added (see below), otherwise the local system time is assumed.

data.name: mbx_DirectoryElementCollection_ErrorParsing

data.name: mbx_FrmEditFileData_ErrorAPIError
data.value: The app encountered errors communicating with the API. If you got an Unauthorised error, pls set your username as password in the settings.
data.comment: Error informing the user that there was something wrong while trying to talk to the GeoNames API

data.name: mbx_FrmEditFileData_ErrorInvalidSender
data.value: This will be a bug. Please file an issue on github and that the 'sender' was:
data.comment: Generic error message telling the user "something has gone wrong."

data.name: mbx_FrmEditFileData_WarningFileDisappeared

data.comment: Warning that the file the user was trying to edit has disappeared (realistaically deleted in the background)

data.name: mbx_FrmEditFileData_WarningLatLongMustBeNumbers
data.value: This needs to have numbers only. Will default to zero.
data.comment: Warns the user that they've tried to assign a non-numeric value to latitude or longitude.

data.name: mbx_FrmImportExportGpx_AskUserWantsReport

data.name: mbx_FrmImportNoStoredShiftValues
data.value: No "shift" values stored. Data will remain 0.
data.comment: Location: Import/Export GPX. This basically means that the user tried to apply a time shift (like shift by 1 hour or some such) but didn't specify how they wanted the shift to take place.

data.name: mbx_FrmMainApp_QuestionRunImportExportInFlatMode

data.name: mbx_FrmSettings_QuestionWhatToExport

data.name: mbx_FrmSettings_QuestionWhatToImport
data.value: Choose what to Import. Please note that upon successful completion of the Import process the relevant bits of the database will be overwritten. If something fails there will be a backup file of your db in your AppData folder.

data.name: rbt_TryUseGeoNamesLanguage

data.name: rbt_UseGeoNamesLocalLanguage
data.value: Try to use the "local language" when retrieving location names

data.name: rbx_CustomCityLogicExplanation
data.value: This is an advanced feature. AdminName1-4 & ToponymName refer to the API outputs so if you don't understand that, probably don't poke this at all. For an overall rundown, check: https://github.com/nemethviktor/GeoTagNinja/issues/38#issuecomment-1356844255 . What this Setting does is that you can add your own choices of countries to get the "City" value from one of the specific AdminNames.

data.name: rbx_CustomCityLogicExplanationBold
data.value: Note that changes to the table below are immediately affected and the OK/Cancel button has no effect per se on them. You also need to right-click and click Reset Cached Data for any files that may be affected by your changes if you want to pull data within this session (or just restart the app.)

data.name: rbx_CustomRulesExplanation
data.value: This is an advanced feature. AdminName1-4 & ToponymName refer to the API outputs so if you don't understand that, probably don't poke this at all. Re: "Predetermined countries" (checkbox below): Read about those here: https://github.com/nemethviktor/GeoTagNinja/issues/38#issuecomment-1356844255 + check the other tab - Note if you disable that setting it then will blank CountryCode cells that fall outside the relevant grouping but won't actually drop those rows. All columns are compulsory exc for "Custom" but if you set the Outcome to "Custom" and leave the "Custom" col empty the row will be ignored. Data is not-case-sensitive. For each datapoint (e.g. City, State) the last row overwrites the previous ones. Basically be sensible. The more rows you add the slower it will get. Example: the default data return from the API for London UK is poor because for that particular region adminName2 = "Greater London", and it'd be discarded as such (cities are usually from "ToponymName"). -> set: "what" = "adminName2", "if" = "is", "Condition Value" = "Greater London", "then" = "City", "becomes" = "adminName2". Repeat the whole thing in a 2nd row but "then" = "Sub_Loction" and "becomes" = "ToponymName".

data.name: rbx_CustomRulesExplanationBold
data.value: Note that changes to the table below are immediately affected and the OK/Cancel button has no effect per se on them. You also need to right-click and click Reset Cached Data for any files that may be affected by your changes if you want to pull data within this session (or just restart the app.)

data.name: rbx_Register_ArcGIS
data.value: You'll need an ArcGIS API key to use the map search functionality. ArcGIS have changed their registration process as of June 2024. Register [here](https://location.arcgis.com/sign-up/) You now need to specify a portal url. Just input anything you want. Scroll/Go to `Developer credential creator` Then `New Item` Then `Developer Credentials` Pick `API Key` (not OAUth) Set your expiration date to as far into the future as you can (1 year) Leave `Referrers` blank On the next page pick `Geocoding (not stored)` On the next page skip `Item Access` On the next page add any title Eventually click `Generate the API key and go to item details page. I am ready to copy and save the key.` Save the API key when prompted. If you don't do it at the time you'll have to generate another one.

data.name: rbx_Register_GeoNames
data.value: You'll need a GeoNames Account to use the reverse geocoding/search function (lat/long --> country/city/...). Get one here: http://www.geonames.org/login and then enable "Free Web Services" access here: https://www.geonames.org/manageaccount

data.name: tmi_File_CopyGeoData
data.comment: Button to copy all geodata from a file (to the clipboard)

data.name: tmi_File_FlatMode
data.comment: Toggle Flat Mode. This will trigger parsing subfolders too.

data.name: tmi_File_PasteGeoData
data.comment: Button to paste all geodata from a file (from the clipboard)

data.name: tmi_Help_BugReport
data.comment: Open Browser to GitHub and file a bug report.

data.name: tmi_Help_FeedbackFeatureRequest
data.comment: Open Browser to GitHub and file a feature req.

data.name: tsb_BugReport
data.value: File a bug report (requires a GitHub account)

data.name: tsb_FeedbackFeatureRequest
data.value: File a feature request (requires a GitHub account)

data.name: tsb_GetAllFromWeb
data.value: Get Toponomy & Altitude info for all of the selected files

data.name: ttp_GPSDataPaste
data.value: Press CTRL+V to paste a valid pair of decimals to the lat/long placeholders. The clipboard should contain only a pair of decimals, preferably in "invariant" (English) setup, which is integer-dot-decimal-comma-integer-dot-decimal, such as 12.345, 56.897 That said the code _should_ be able to comprehend other layouts. Note if the clipboard has anything apart from the above the operation will fail (nothing will happen.)

data.name: ttp_LoadFavourite
data.value: Load metadata for the selected file(s) from your Favourites

data.name: ttp_loctToFile
data.value: Save the Current Coordinate to the Selected File(s)

data.name: ttp_loctToFileDestination
data.value: Save the Current Coordinate to the Selected Files' Destination

data.name: ttp_NavigateMapGo
data.value: Put Coordinates of Selected Files onto the Map

data.name: ttp_OffsetTime
data.value: Time Zones are left as blank on open regardless of what the stored value is. There is no Exif Tag for TZ but only 'Offset', which is something like '+01:00'. As there is no indication for neither TZ nor DST per se I can't ascertain that '+01:00' was in fact say BST rather than CET, one being DST the other not. Either adjust manually or pull from web - the combination of coordinates + createDate would decisively inform the program of the real TZ value. The value in the read-only textbox will be saved in the file.

data.name: ttp_SaveFavourite
data.value: Save (or overwrite) the currently selected file's metadata to your Favourites

data.name: cmi_OpenCoordsInBrowser
data.comment: Open the file's GPS coordinates in a browser windows (maps, not api this time.)

data.name: tmi_File_ImportFavouritesFromGeoSetter
data.comment: Dropdown to open a Form to import Geosetter Favourites

data.name: ofd_Settings_GetDatabaseFileToImport_SelectDatabaseFile
data.comment: This is a label (but technically part of an OFD hence the name) that requests the user picks a "database file" (really a sqlite file with a .db extension)

data.name: mbx_FrmMainApp_InfoImportGeoSetterFavouritesDone
data.comment: Displays a success message that items have been imported. The code will stamp a number at the very end. (count of items that is.)

data.name: ckb_ShowThumbnails
data.value: Show Image Thumbnails rather than Grid

data.name: ttp_ShowThumbnails
data.value: This causes a very significant performance hit (up to 7x by my measurements) so it's not recommended.

data.name: ttp_FrmImportExport_SaveDefaults
data.value: Saves certain defaults. Currently: import source location, TZ & DST settings, max inter/extrapolation.
data.comment: Location: GPX Import-Export. Not having it as a 'Generic' as the button associated doesn't really save all values' defaults and I don't know how I might change that later.
